thread.title: H.S. FOOTBALL: Bishop Brossart rolls past Berea Community in district finale
thread.title_full: H.S. FOOTBALL: Bishop Brossart rolls past Berea Community in district finale

author: Register Staff Report
title: H.S. FOOTBALL: Bishop Brossart rolls past Berea Community in district finale
text:
The Berea Community football team was eliminated from a spot in the Class A Playoffs with a 39-6 loss on Friday at Bishop Brossart. 
With the loss, the Pirates fall to 0-9 and 0-4 in the district. 
Berea’s only touchdown came on a 48-yard touchdown pass from Tyler Pumphrey to Deondre Tate in the fourth quarter. 
The Mustangs (8-1, 3-1 district) quickly took in the district finale for both teams. 
Bryce Donnelly caught a 25-yard touchdown pass from quarterback Craig Pfefferman in the first quarter and Griffin Goepper added a 1-yard TD run moments later. 
In the second quarter, Chase Keller scored on a 49-yard run to put Bishop Brossart up 19-0. Less than a minute later, Frank Cetrulo scored on a 16-yard run. Just before the half, Donnelly caught a 43-yard touchdown pass from Pfefferman to give the Mustangs a 32-0 lead at the half. 
Cetrulo added a 65-yard run in the third quarter. 
Tate’s touchdown reception was his team-best ninth of the season for Berea. 
Paris (9-0, 4-0) won the Class A, District 5 title and will be a No. 1 seed in the playoffs. Bishop Brossart finishes second, Nicholas County was third and Bracken County finished fourth. 
The top four teams in each district make the playoffs. 
Berea will wrap up the season next week at Estill County. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
